column3:
ACK, compiles and runs on my Mac.

I'll let somebody else comment on the API, network programming isn't my thing.
Code changes OK, compiles and runs on Ubuntu 11.10.\n

Forgot to mention: because name lookups happen using the unified getaddrinfo() call, a #define _WIN32_WINNT 0x501 was necessary, which means WIndows XP or later. Is it a problem to break compatibility with Windows 2000 and earlier (not even sure it still worked on those)?\n
Yes, I noticed that, but it's fine with me, no need to support >10yr old\nOSes\n
Bitcoin currently doesnt work on pre-WinXP (due to issues with the build of miniupnpc, which I still havent fixed, but I suppose if you are going to break it again, might as well not bother)...\n
@laanwj: by the way, does it work in the windows dev environment as well?\n

overall ACK

Minor quibble, maybe ignore-able:  The connection logic in CService feels like it belongs in a separate class.  CService and CNetAddr seem more focused on address and/or endpoint datum, whereas the connect() logic seems more in the socket realm.
@jgarzik: I moved ConnectSocket out of CService.\n
